data.title: Daytona 6265 Silver Sigma
data.text:
"A Dayto", that's a little nickname from its fans : taken from its full name Oyster Perpetual Cosmograph Daytona, it is elevated among legends from Rolex. Its full pedigree ages back to 1959, when the Daytona International Speedway opened. At that time, Rolex became the official watch from a race renown for its 31 degrees uphill curves.

By 1963, Rolex becomes a major partner of the Daytona International Speedway and launches the Cosmograph Daytona, a watch dedicated to race pilots. That's how a legend was born.

This sports'watch built by Rolex is already at that time a major innovation thanks to its functionalities dedicated to race drivers : with a major contrast on its dial offering maximum lisibility and its tachymeter scale on the outer part of the bezel.

However the public success was minimum, and surprisingly, the older versions of the Daytona are today the ones that reaches peaks at auctions : the mythical "Paul Newman tropical dial" hold a record.

By 1988, a major switch has been made : the automatic movement equipped Daytona watches. Why ? Quartz crisis, and a form of weariness from manual movements... The ref. 16520 was born, using a Zenith movement (Caliber 400, El Primero), modified by Rolex. It lasted from 1988 to 2000, before Rolex decided to build its own movement.

The last evolution of the Rolex Daytona came with the 116500LN, released in 2016. A brand new cerachrom black bezel to maximize its resistance, and new dials with variations like the one made from a meteor...
